summary: This email chain from August 12-13, 2019, summarizes voluntary interviews conducted by OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY with MCC employees regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details failures in protocol, including missed inmate counts and a non-working camera system in the SHU, and notes that the two officers who discovered Epstein declined to be interviewed.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.role: Email recipient, likely a supervisor or colleague
persons.context: Recipient of the email summarizing the MCC interviews regarding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Discovered the radio call for medical staff, responded to the SHU, saw Officer Noel, entered Epstein's cell, and performed CPR. Confronted officers about missed counts and the missing cellmate.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: Was in the SHU and informed Lt. that Epstein had hung himself. Admitted to not conducting the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts and was questioned about Epstein's missing cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found dead in his cell in the SHU on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: Was performing CPR on Epstein when Lt. arrived. Stated 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do the counts' regarding the protocol failures.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Assisted Epstein with making a personal phone call days before his death, using an unrecorded legal line. Left Epstein with Officers Noel and another male officer after the call.

persons.name: Capt.
persons.role: Captain overseeing the whole prison at MCC
persons.context: Stated he gave oral commands that Epstein needed a cellmate at all times after an earlier suicide attempt. Was unaware the cellmate had been moved or that cameras were not working until after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was moved out of the cell, reportedly for court. His departure left Epstein alone in the cell.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: One of the two officers who discovered Epstein's body. She and Michael Thomas did not agree to speak with investigators.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: One of the two officers who discovered Epstein's body. He and Tova Noel did not agree to speak with investigators.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the summary email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Both were the correctional officers on duty in the SHU who discovered Epstein's body and were implicated in failing to conduct required inmate counts.
Lt., as operations lieutenant, responded to Officer Noel's report of the incident and later questioned her about protocol failures.
Lt. assisted Epstein with making a personal phone call on an unrecorded line days before his death.
Capt. oversees all lieutenants, including those like Lt. who report to him on unit operations.
Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the SHU before being moved out, which left Epstein alone.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at approximately 6:33 a.m.

events.title: Missed Inmate Counts
events.description: Officers Noel and Thomas admitted to not conducting the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts on the night/morning leading to Epstein's death.

events.title: MCC Employee Interviews
events.description: OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted voluntary interviews with several MCC employees (Lt., Lt., Capt.) regarding the circumstances of Epstein's death.

events.title: Refusal to be Interviewed
events.description: Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, who discovered Epstein, did not agree to speak with investigators and could not be served subpoenas.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY)
keyFacts: Epstein was found dead in his SHU cell on the morning of August 10, 2019; Officer Thomas was performing CPR when Lt. arrived.
Officers Noel and Thomas admitted to failing to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts, with Thomas stating 'we messed up'.
Epstein's cellmate, Reyes, had been moved out of the cell, leaving Epstein alone, contrary to orders that he have a cellmate at all times following a prior suicide attempt.
The camera system in the SHU was not working at the time of Epstein's death, and prison leadership (Capt.) was unaware of this issue.
The two officers who discovered Epstein's body, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, refused to be interviewed by investigators on August 12, 2019.
